title: method data
description: Definition of a method that can be applied by a creator to some source data to create a data set. By defining the method and the source data, the origin of the data set can be traced back.

id.description: This id represents the method which is specified below.

description.description: Here the method can be described in free text.

categories.title: With this array, it is defined whether the method is a measurement or a calculation only or both.

reference.description: If the method is an implementation of a standard or of a procedure described in a publication, this reference can be defined here.

items.description: Additional references that supplement the one given in the property `reference`, like tutorials or manuals as supplements to a formal specification.

validity.description: Here you can define since when the method is valid and until when. This can be helpful for example when a regulation or standard changes.

available.description: Here you can define since when the method has been available and until when. This can be helpful for example when a method is shared considerably later than when it was created. You can also use it to define that the method may have been available for a long time even though it may not be valid for the whole time of its availability.

calculation.description: Here you can define the calculation procedure in detail.

service.title: If the method is available as a service, the endpoint and the API specification are defined here.

endpoint.description: The web address of the endpoint to which input data can be send and which returns output data according to the method.

specification.description: The web address of the API specification which describes how to send input data and receive output data which was processed by the method.

calculation.title: A web address which defines the calculation procedure in detail.
calculation.description: If the calculation procedure is open, the web address should refer to the repository for example at github.com. If the calculation procedure is closed, the web address should provide an explanation of procedure and may describe options to download executables.

appliedMethod.title: Applied method, that is the application of a method with fixed arguments to specific source data.

method.description: Method that was applied by the creator on the source data.

items.description: Named arguments to configure the method.
Named data sources to which the method was applied.

namedSource.title: Source data which is an input for a method. A creator uses a method and source data to create a new data set.

dataKind.description: Data kind, either calorimetric, hygrothermal, optical, or photovoltaic.

database.description: Information about a database which has implemented the same API specification.

webAddress.description: The database is identified by its API endpoint.

owner.description: The institution which owns the database

admin.description: The institution which administrates the database

validity.description: For which timespan the data of the database is valid

available.description: For which timespan the database is or was available

internalComment.description: If there are any specific issues with a database, the administrators can use this string.
